history.content:
Declared LSCS/EECS majors who are entering your 4th year seem to be able to enroll in upper div cs classes  --including 194-26-- now.   Seniors by units are not able to do so currently.

 

SIS project staff told me very recently (yesterday afternoon) that SIS will not be able to note class standing by unit until at least August 24 or so (if ever).  This is different than information that I had heard before but here we are.

 

At this point, for both phase 1 or phase 2 of enrollments, we will change the screen so that anyone who is officially declared LSCS or EECS will be able to enroll in upper div cs classes.  This will be implemented tomorrow. Students should be able to enroll either by tomorrow late morning or at the latest Wednesday afternoon.

 

If this doesn't work, please do reach out to me Wednesday afternoon.  We want to make sure we get this right as soon as possible.

 

This does mean seniors will have a shorter window of getting to enroll ahead of juniors or sophomores but it seems better than not allowing seniors by unit to have access during phase 1 to upper division cs classes.

 

I really apologize for not being able to share clear information earlier.  I had repeatedly asked for clarity about SIS system capabilities for 4-5 months specifically so that we could change our enrollment procedures if necessary and so we could give you accurate information by the time the schedule of classes went live if not before.  I wasn't provided with that information until just now.

I'm interested in the course, and I've seen people having issues enrolling into it. Anyone know the current status of whether it can be waitlisted/enrolled, and by whom? (Also what the current enrollment stats are, not sure where to check that)
history.subject: CS 194-26

history.content: I'm interested in the course, and I've seen people having issues enrolling into it. Anyone know the current status of its enrollment? (Also not sure where to check that)
history.subject: CS 194-26
